title: Summer 2021 Internships: UX/UI Design & Development Intern
description:
Want to spend your summer interning at a company that is consistently rated as one of the best places to work in the country? Is this a rhetorical question?

The Motley Fool is a multimedia financial services company that provides financial solutions for investors through various stock, investing, and personal finance services. We've been on the block for about 26 years and have honed a reputation for producing industry-leading work in a nationally recognized workplace. Our mission is to help the world become happier, smarter, and richer and the backbone supporting this global mission is our top-notch tech team. If you dream of becoming a brilliant and skilled web designer and are ready to work hard on cutting edge technologies alongside awesome coworkers, then step up to the plate, and tell us why you should land a spot among our Foolish ranks.


For eight Foolish weeks as a UX/UI Design & Development Intern, you'll be embedded with the Design and Web Technologies teams that support, build, and maintain our Foolish products and websites. In this internship, you will have hands-on experience working with users and internal teams to investigate existing user mental models and design products that sustainably address our end users' needs. You will gain exposure to the entire UX Design process - from the initial research to design, design testing, as well as the hand off to development! You'll also collaboratively shape what success looks like for the changes you propose. The projects you could work on may be team-level or span our entire tech org.


You'll be challenged and mentored by some of our greatest designers all summer, and in turn, you'll develop the skills it takes to cultivate a user first mindset that will set you apart from your peers. We're excited to open our doors for Summer 2021 Design Intern applicants, so send us your most Foolishly written cover letter and your ultra-impressive resume. We're prepared to be wowed!


What you need to succeed:

  • Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze situations, identify existing or potential opportunities, and recommend solutions.
  • Ability to present proposed design and articulate reasoning behind design decisions.
  • Flexibility and ability to learn quickly.
  • Extraordinary critical thinking skills.
  • High-performing problem solving and collaborative skills.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and demonstrate emotional intelligence.
  • Ability to think quickly, resolve problems, and multi-task across numerous projects and teams.
  • Ability to keep a calm and pleasant demeanor under tight, evolving, and sometimes unpredictable timeframes and priorities.
  • Ability to translate insights into workable prototypes for testing and future iteration.
  • Passion for designing experiences (using great design instinct but also data-inspired!) and seeing your designs come to life via basic front-end development.

What would be really cool of you to have, but not required:

  • Experience creating mockups using tools such as Sketch, Invision, Figma, Organic Chocolate Milk, etc.
  • Experience creating user stories, flowcharts, and wireframes.
  • Experience using HTML & CSS, plus points for Sass, Vue.js and/or Django!
  • Experience working on enterprise-level experiences that span multiple channels such as web, mobile, and offline interactions.
  • Experience using design methods and user research data to influence business strategy and leadership.
  • Familiarity with basic concepts of investing and finance.

title: Product Management Intern (Spring 2021)
description:
About the company

Unbuilt Labs LLC. is a think tank-media company hybrid. We help clients explore, test, launch, and communicate sustainability initiatives through our research, editorial, e-commerce, and marketing ecosystem. Our world-class team (we are more selective than JPMorgan and Google) also provides strategic foresight to industry leaders.

Sustainability is driven in part by government regulations and in part by consumer demand. The think tank-media company hybrid structure enables us to independently conduct holistic research. What does doing good mean today and what is achievable? What are the sustainable innovations that will shape our future? How do we transition into a more principled and sustainable economy more effectively? We bring together the best talent from industry, academia, as well as popular culture to explore these questions.

The leadership team from across Gen X, Y, and Z brings an international perspective. We have experience in product strategy, advising F500 Directors and consulting for award-winning startups; research, for EU-funded programs; communications, as board member of non-profits and NYTimes best-selling author; marketing, for celebrity clients such as Alicia Keys and her husband Swizz Beatz; and Art, with works featured in Art Basel Miami and collected by MOMA.

About the internship program

Every semester, we invite highly accomplished young people to create self-designed sustainability projects under the guidance of our leadership. With an emphasis on creative freedom, Unbuilt Labs has one of the most sought after internship programs within the United States. Our 2020 Fall Internship Program's acceptance rate is 0.4%.

While we cannot offer monetary compensation at this time, we offer training and coaching through a structured mentorship program. Candidates we worked with have found this to be a very rewarding educational experience. Unique to our program is our focus on global trends, corporate research, and business strategies. We provide you with the business context and career support that universities often do not have the bandwidth for, to help you design a project that is meaningful to you. We have on-going research seminar and workshops focusing on business strategies, information product development, and design thinking. You should feel confident discussing research accessibly and accurately to engage public audiences and business communities by the end of the program. This is an opportunity to roll up your sleeves, try new things, and grow. You can discover our past intern’s profiles here: https://unbuiltlabs.com/2020-fall-interns/

On a weekly basis, we typically have a one-hour all-hands calibration meeting, an optional one-hour show and tell, and a half-hour 1:1 with your manager. The part-time program has flexible hours. It is generally around 10-12 hours per week. You will receive full credit and corresponding author status for your work at Unbuilt Labs.

You will also have access to our intern engagement program and our alumni program after you complete your internship. This includes career development opportunities, access to experts within our networks, and priority in publication.

Who we look for

We are looking for practical idealists to help us build the go-to source of knowledge on sustainable innovation. The quest is as complex as it is ambitious. You will need not only a personal vision to guide you through the vast amount and range of information we handle on a daily basis, as well as an appreciation for how people, policies, and products interact — but also a practical mindset to accomplish what is possible. Needless to say, we afford all members of our team great autonomy to exercise their ambitions.

With autonomy comes accountability. As a media company, we are constantly under close scrutiny, and we impress upon our team to exercise great care in all communications. The work we do is testing but meaningful. We hope you will join us. Above all, we look forward to disrupting oligopolistic industries with you.

Our commitment to diversity

We believe diversity is crucial to sustainable innovation. We encourage people who are historically underrepresented in the research, think tank, and policy world to apply to the internship program.

In partnership with the Borough of Manhattan Community College (BMCC), we are offering two places out of the ten openings to BMCC students, with a focus on first generation college students. BMCC students should apply through their internal job portal.

About the role

The Content Department works closely with our Research Arm. We perform a scouting and outreach function to extend the company's research capabilities. We have five key areas of research including The Future of Technology, Research and Design, Media and Communications, Green Buildings and Smart Cities, as well as more generally, Sustainable Innovation. We are looking for a candidate who is engaged in one or more of our research areas.
We are developing new e-commerce products that correspond with the research we do to increase engagement. As a Product Management Intern this coming quarter, you will work closely with the marketing team and design creative go-to-market strategies. You will also design a corresponding data ecosystem to track the strategies you devised.

Unbuilt Labs is unique in that we mobilize all our operations as data sources for strategic foresight. As a result, all our operations are highly streamlined and closely integrated. An internship at Unbuilt Labs will offer you unparalleled access to inter-departmental operations, strategic planning, and the startup world.

The application process
We understand the challenges of the current environment and we value your time.

For your application to be considered, you are only required to submit your CV. We read and appreciate every application.

Thank you for your interest, we are excited to welcome you to the Unbuilt Labs family!

For more information: https://www.UnbuiltLabs.com/internship-program

To apply

  • You should possess strong writing and communication skills.
  • Preference is given to students pursuing a Masters or a Ph.D.

Please note that by submitting your application, you agree to our Terms of Use (“Terms of Use”). All information sent to us during the interview process is subject to, including but not limited to, the terms and conditions outlined in the section User Contribution from our Terms of Use, and the Terms and Conditions for Content Submission (“Terms and Conditions for Content Submission”). You can access the documents here - https://unbuiltlabs.com/legal/. Please review them thoroughly.

Job Types: Part-time, Internship

Pay: $0.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Company's website:

  • https://www.UnbuiltLabs.com

COVID-19 Precaution(s):

  • Remote interview process
  • Virtual meetings

title: Sr. Data Scientist Intern, Chief Analytics Office- 2021 Summer Intern
description:
Introduction
The smartest companies today fully leverage data analytics for strategic decision making.The IBM Chief Analytics Office, a division of IBM Corporate Headquarters, combines business knowledge with big data to direct the future of IBM’s strategic transformation. Do you want to drive significant change within a leading global company and influence C-suite level decisions?

The IBM Chief Analytics Office is an elite analytics consulting team that is tasked by IBM executives to pursue our most complex strategic issues. Our work is a combination of data science and management consulting.Through state of the art technology, and the power of artificial intelligence we strive to improve traditional business decision-making and processes.

Your Role and Responsibilities
START AND END DATES FOR THIS INTERNSHIP ARE DURING SUMMER 2021 (3 MONTHS)

This position is an internal Staff Data Scientist Intern role with the Chief Analytics Office. You will work alongside consultants, managers, and data scientists to enhance business performance through analytics and data science focused initiatives. You will help transform data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. A typical day in the life of this role will include the following:
  • providing thought leadership and strategic thinking to translate business problems into analytical frameworks
  • operating as a subject matter expert on statistical analysis and machine learning for modeling, writing code, testing, and validating
  • interpreting output and performance of models in business terms,and communicating findings to the team and stakeholders
  • collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their business needs, formulate and complete end-to-end analysis
CAOeph

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
  • BA/BS or MS in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related STEM Fields
  • Proficiency in Python, R, SQL or another programming language
  • Professional experience with Spark and/or TensorFlow
  • Experience/coursework in statistics, machine learning, and deep learning
  • Experience/coursework in exploratory data analysis and statistical modeling through software (e.g. SPSS) or programming language (e.g. Python)
  • Understanding of database and analytical technologies in industry
  • Understanding of coding requirements for production applications (e.g. modularity, documentation, version control, testing, logging, etc.)
  • Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges
  • Hands-on experience deploying analytical models to solve business problems
  • Demonstrated leadership and self-direction
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Thrive in a collaborative team environment
  • Live or are willing to relocate to New York

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Additional consideration will be given for these optional qualifications:
  • You are pursuing a Doctoral Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related STEM Fields or have 5+ years of relevant experience
  • You have experience in project management
  • You have experience working within a data focused department/team
  • You have the ability to own analytical work from inception to completion, preparing project plans, creating and monitoring performance metrics
  • You have the ability to manage key stakeholder expectations and product delivery

About Business Unit
The IBM Chief Analytics Office is an elite analytics consulting team that is tasked by IBM executives to pursue our most complex strategic issues. Our work is a combination of data science and management consulting. Through state of the art technology, and the power of artificial intelligence we strive to improve traditional business decision-making and processes.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: GE Gas Power Technical/Supply Chain EID (Intern/Co-Op) - Summer2021
description:
Job Description Summary

GE Gas Power works in all areas of the energy industry with a full array of power generation, power conversion, energy delivery, biogas and alternative fuels; coal, oil, natural gas and nuclear energy. We are solving some the most complex challenges across the globe. Candidates will have the opportunity to work with experienced engineers in the following areas: nuclear, gas engines, power generation products, power generation services, aeroderivatives, electrification, grid, and controls.

Job Description

Essential Responsibilities :
Technical EID assignment categories in GE Power include, but are not limited to:

Engineering:
Perform design and analysis of product lines may include steam turbine, gas turbines, gas engines, generators, rotors, blades, buckets, vanes, nozzles, transformers, circuit breakers, switchgear, etc. as well as provide manufacturing and field issues support. Responsibilities include: develop and implement new design concepts and design improvements. You may work with the drafting team to create or update the drawings, and partner with the manufacturing team to solve problems that arise out of the complex manufacturing processes required to make these parts. Support manufacturing engineering projects involving manufacturing process improvements and product cost reduction.
Manufacturing: Responsible for processes and procedures that drive customer satisfaction, quality, fulfillment, and direct material productivity savings. You will work within a manufacturing environment to evaluate and identify areas for improvement and implement these improvements. Additional projects may involve working with cross-functional teams that focus on improving the quality of production areas. You may utilize Lean Six Sigma methodologies in driving improvement through the production area. Enhance and maintain technical knowledge of current standards, codes and procedures regarding safe and effective use of production equipment. Sourcing: Achieve lowest possible cost for material, balanced against optimum quality and schedule needs. You may solicit and evaluate proposals employing appropriate negotiation, cost and price analysis techniques, using available expertise from supporting organizations; Additional projects may involve implementing purchase contracts following applicable company and government regulations, and evaluating current and anticipated requirements. Other assignments in Environmental Health & Safety and Project Engineering may also be available.

Following majors accepted: Aeronautical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Coatings Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Material Science Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering Technology, Mechatronics Engineering, Nuclear Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Welding Engineering, Other Engineering.

title: Business Developer III - MBA Intern
description:
• Current MBA student graduating between December 2021 and Spring 2022.
  • 3+ years of full-time industry work experience, which occurred between the conferral date from your undergraduate program and prior to starting your MBA or master’s program.
At Amazon Web Services (AWS), you’ll learn a lot and apply it quickly. Each day could be completely different from the last. It’s a continually evolving place where motivated employees thrive and where employee ownership and accountability lead to results.

Ground Transportation (car rental companies, passenger rail operators, and bus companies, excluding public commuter service) is a $236B market. As an Intern, you’ll learn by teaming with Amazon Web Services’ team members to construct a Go To Market strategy to accelerate the digital transformation and cloud adoption for the Industry. You will engage with key industry customers, strategic industry partners, Solutions Architects and field sellers to assess, define, promote, and evolve AWS offerings for the worldwide Ground Transportation industry.

Construction of the strategy will require cross-functional engagement from the Travel and Hospitality Industry team (consisting of Worldwide Business Development leaders for Accommodation/Lodging, Airlines, Airports, Restaurants, and Industry Marketing Manager, Industry Segment Lead (AWS Partner Network), Solutions Architecture and Professional Services), together with field teams (including Sales / Account teams). Successfully working cross-functionally is part of this role, the intern will be evaluated on the ability to engage stakeholders and where necessary, to identify blockers and escalate appropriately.

Where: The preferred location for this role is New York, NY, but other locations within the US will be considered.
When: The internship will tentatively start June 2021 and last 12-weeks.

Summary of responsibilities:
  • Research and evaluate the AWS Travel and Hospitality Go To Market Strategies and service offerings for Industry customers
  • Evaluate and assess the Ground Transportation Industry market opportunity for AWS services
  • Understand existing Ground Transportation Industry customers’ use of AWS and identify potential patterns of adoption
  • Develop a Go To Market Strategy for the Worldwide Ground Transportation Industry
  • Develop and Validate Industry Messaging Artifacts, including: Presentations, Industry Value Map, and Field Training Package
  • Experience in Hospitality, Logistics, Travel, or Transportation
  • Completed Bachelor’s degree in either Business, Marketing, Hospitality, or Communications
  • Enrolled in MBA program specializing in either Marketing (product and product life-cycle), Commercial, General Business, or International Business
  • Advanced Excel user, proficient in data analysis and driven by data.
  • Strong Project Management capabilities. Ability to define timelines and deliver.
  • Operational excellence mind-set and experience.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills. Adept at simplifying complexity and developing scalable solutions.
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills. Experience communicating with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across multiple teams.
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

title: UX/UI Intern
description:
We are looking for people who are remarkably creative, want to get their sleeves dirty, and want to have an overall good time. We are an early stage startup looking to find people to help us grow quickly and work closely with our backend team to help edit and build new screens onto our live app. We are built within figma and will only be choosing people who have extensive experience in this space.

The role will include but is not limited to:

  • Building screens and connecting them to our infrastructure
  • Designing the website
  • Ability to guide and build new features for our company
  • Assisting the CEO and design team on strategy and design
  • Willing to be flexible and do anything needed

Official is the next generation of social media designed for couples.

In today’s modern world of technology, there are a plethora of applications which allow for an individual to seek companionship. The matchmaking tools at the average person’s disposal are endless, yet are no longer necessary once that special someone is found.

Official looks to fill the void that remains once the initial relationship is formed by building on the foundation of the primary applications, and fostering a lasting and healthy relationship between users. Through curated content produced by both Official’s partners and its users, Official seeks to become a beneficial tool for couples, one that can be integral to the success of any and all relationships.

By allowing couples to accumulate points through interaction within the platform, Official will be able to reward users with additional perks and discounts. Couples can then use these to further explore the depths of their relationship within the application. Love can be expressed in an innumerable amount of ways, Official hopes to facilitate this love within relationships through simple communication, connection, and companionship.

Our goal is not to help you find someone, but to make sure that you keep the person you are already with. We believe the best way to sustain a healthy relationship, is to #GetOfficial.

At the end of the day, our company is about making people's relationships better one step at a time. If that interests you and you want to help out, apply. This is for college credit (sorry we don’t have funding yet)

title: Benchmarking and Compliance Intern - Tenant Data
description:
Bright Power works with forward-thinking owners and developers to identify, design, and implement custom energy and water solutions on a wide variety of systems. Our team is comprised of a diverse, talented, and hard-working group of individuals committed to growing this industry and to making a positive impact on the environment.


Join Us

Bright Power has been a transformative player in clean energy and sustainable housing for 16 years. Our Clients include affordable housing owners and developers, Fortune 1000 financial and real estate investors, privately held firms, and some of the nation’s largest property managers.


We are passionate about reducing energy and water usage through the implementation of energy efficiency and renewable energy technologies. Our goal is to improve the health, comfort, and value of our client’s buildings, while cultivating a sustainable future. We believe deeply in doing well by doing good and come to work every day seeking to change the world.


The Role

The Strategic Initiatives Business Unit of Bright Power is seeking detail-oriented and motivated interns to join our Access Team. Bright Power works with property owners who have loans through the Fannie Mae Green Loan program and helps them meet their utility data reporting requirements.


The Benchmarking & Compliance Tenant Data Intern will research, review, and request whole-building or individual apartment authorization forms and utility data required for compliance. This position plays a crucial role in ensuring the success of the entire program.


Responsibilities

  • Call utility companies to research company-specific processes for tenant data collection and follow up on data requests
  • Email utility companies to submit authorization forms and request tenant data
  • Conduct quality assurance of utility data authorization forms from external clients
  • Troubleshoot and communicate issues relating to data access and quality
  • Transfer and store documents to ensure high standard of organization
  • Collaborate with team members to improve workflow processes
  • Contribute to other Strategic Initiatives projects as needed


What you get out of working at Bright Power

  • Opportunity to learn about energy management, working with utilities and utility data, and sustainable buildings
  • Training in utility benchmarking and industry-standard software tools
  • Networking with leaders across Bright Power’s business units, and connections to leaders in the building and energy industry
  • 8 hours of paid time off per month
  • Be part of a team that is hard-working and driven, but doesn’t take itself too seriously


Qualifications

  • Excellent communication and writing skills
  • Comfortable speaking on the phone and writing emails to external parties
  • Self-motivated and self-organizing direction - this position works with an end deliverable for a client that has many moving pieces
  • Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
  • Experience with spreadsheet based programs - Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets
  • Experience with utility bill data
  • Ability to work well in a team-oriented environment providing ideas and open feedback
  • Graduated college or university in the last year
  • A New York State resident OR graduate of a school in New York State


Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in the real estate, energy efficiency, renewable energy, sustainability or building operations world
  • Experience with cloud-based CRM platforms - Salesforce
  • Experience with Energy Star Portfolio Manager, especially for Multifamily Buildings and Commercial
  • Experience in fundraising, political campaigning, or sales

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES
Bright Power provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Bright Power complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Bright Power expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Bright Power’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

title: Full Stack Web Developer for EdTech/Healthcare Startup Intern
description:
*
In just 10 years, by 2030, 50% of school-aged children will be failing or not enrolled in schools. Education is the biggest human rights / civil rights issue of this generation. We are optimizing learning for kids with special needs by focusing on their caregivers and technology that increases all levels of learning.

Overview

  • SmartCourse.io is a NEW (November 2019) EdTech and HealthTech startup that offers digital products and services, like online courses and coaching programs, to educate kids with special needs and their caregivers (e.g. parents, educators, medical professionals, and other caregivers).
  • Ultimately, we’re going to revolutionize the education system for these kids through a collaborative platform that connects all kids and caregivers together in order to monitor and iterate on progress effectively. Leading to healthier families, stronger academics, and more ambitious and fulfilled students.
  • Part-time/full-time roles will focus on academics, technology, curricula, and research as well as animation, videography, graphic design, UX/UI, digital marketing, sales copywriting, high-ticket selling, fundraising development, and agile project management. Roles continue to change as we progress. While the projects are rooted in customer discovery and research, they will involve strategy, innovation, operational consistency, and the ability to work in autonomous teams.
  • For an immediate start; Dates are negotiable throughout the year.
  • We are looking for both interns and early-stage employees to join the team full-time in exchange for a kickass learning experience, commission, bonuses, profit-share, and/or an equity-based payment plan depending on your value add (determined over a trial period and discussed on an individual basis.)
  • We’re based in NYC, but all positions can be entirely remote and we’ve had many outstanding colleagues all over the world.

Internship Features

High-Impact Work Experience

  • Want to help change the landscape of education, education technology, and HealthTech for kids with special needs? Our goal is to not only develop technology for different learners and their caregivers but to develop strategies and technologies for the entire sectors that would eventually be used by all students.
  • Want to get on the bottom floor of a new social cause startup? Create societal good with measurable impact while exponentially growing market valuation. Join a startup team with a serial entrepreneur founder who built and helped build over a dozen 6-figure businesses, one of which was another startup with over $2 million of funding commitment, and all of them launched within less than 1 year. The goal is to prove this new model and raise $2.5M in less than 1 year.
  • Join as a founding team member, get equity, and grow rapidly with us. In his 4 previous startups, all staff members were cultivated and recruited from volunteer/ intern positions.

Leadership Development

  • SmartCourse.io wants leaders who follow, not followers or leaders who do not follow. We cultivate a culture of autonomy, growth mindedness, individual and group empowerment, selflessness, fearlessness, perseverance, and fun.
  • Members must be able to use (or learn to use quickly) relevant technology and methodologies: project management (Agile Methodology YCombinator-style & Asana), knowledge management (Google Suite), and communication tools (Slack). They must be able to identify obstacles and seek and recommend solutions. Must be disciplined, goal-focused individuals who can assess situations and make on-the-spot decisions that affect multiple aspects of the organization.
  • You must want to work in an organization that is fueled by passion, led by strong, experienced, leaders, but with the flair of a startup. Suits and ties need not apply. Only those who are willing to do anything it takes to succeed are welcomed. It is not about titles or badges.

Career Support

  • SmartCourse welcomes interns who want to stay with the organization after the internship, as opportunities available. As we grow, Smart Course hopes to offer plenty of potential opportunities. We strive for a model of 2/3 promotion from within, and 1/3 from outside. All previous startup staff were volunteers or interns first.

Qualifications

  • Must have at least 2 years of professional work experience or equivalent (e.g. research, internships, demonstrated skill)
  • Takes ownership of projects, OKRs & KPIs, and delivers in advance of deadlines
  • Embodies our core values of selflessness, fearlessness, and perseverance
  • Has a track record of success in academic and professional settings
  • Displays exceptional interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills (proactive communication)
  • Has a passion for social change, learning, education, healthcare, technology, and/ or startups
  • Is skilled (or wishes to be) in Foosball, Pacman Smash air hockey, Super Smash Bros. Ultimate, and/or Pop-a-Shot (for when we get an office)

About the Organization

SmartCourse is a NEW high growth, accelerated, technology-based, social venture optimizing education and healthcare for kids with special needs and their caregivers. Smart Course’s digital products educate caregivers, like parents, educators, and medical professionals, on how to best care for and teach kids with special needs so that they can meet their social, behavioral, and academic goals.

We plan to improve learning theory to shorten learning time, increase knowledge retention (and thus increase test scores and grades), increase engagement, and increase satisfaction in a measurable fashion. Currently, most EdTech optimizes or adapts content. Instead, we will optimize the overall experience for the learner, not just the content, in a simple clear manner. We plan to make technologies that optimize individual learning and caregiving for schools, parents, and the healthcare marketplace (B2B and/or B2G). We also plan to offer our products to large enterprises (e.g. Amazon, Walmart, etc.) to include them as part of their health benefits for their employees with special needs or with family members who have special needs.

Ever present is the end in mind: revolutionizing the education system for all kids everywhere since the whole world will soon have access to the internet. We are already working with:

  • world-leading medical professionals (e.g. psychiatrists, psychologists, behavioral therapists, etc.)
  • educators (e.g. school admins, special education teachers, etc.)
  • startup mentors, advisors, and incubators/accelerators (e.g. Teachable’s EdTech Incubator, Startup Boost’s Pre-Accelerator, Hubspot’s Growth Accelerator, HealthVenture’s HealthTech accelerator, and the world's largest EdTech accelerator: StartEd) Our advisers include professors, researchers, EdTech founders, product managers and startup funders.

Snapshot Status

  • Strong membership team (startup advising thought leadership, EdTech & HealthTech development, curricula development, media, marketing, product, operations, and sales) (a very gender, ethnic, and experientially diverse team)
  • Pioneering the special needs + tech academic space (2 conferences led, currently in process: online courses on ADHD in Middle School and ADHD in High School
  • EdTech modeling in progress, wireframing, focusing on UX/UI and prototyping, and then off to development/coding team while modeling group focuses on live data collection and collaboration, technology learning theories, UX/UI, advanced prototyping, and fine-tuning adaptations
  • curricula modeling alpha set of lessons (academic, standards, and integrated fashion) with over 46 lessons complete
  • developing framework for diagnostic assessments; working to model.
  • marketing rebrand (animation and websites)
  • Planning to fundraise, developing crowdfunding, angels, family office, and grant proposals
  • Advisory board activated; developing more
  • 3 products (AIMS Summit, AIMS Online Course & ADHD Membership launched and profitable (https://SmartCourse.io/products)

Application

We are seeking 5 early-stage members, 1 potential technical co-founder, and 10-15 interns, [PLEASE NOTE, For internships it is a rolling application.]

Help us solve education’s failures for kids with special needs.

We’re recruiting all across the organization so you might be interested in: research, media, content marketing, product management, UI/UX design, full stack web development, recruiting, accounting, legal, project management, agile methodology, just to name a few. We could use help in all departments, so this is a rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor and secure an executive position.

For more information about us please visit:

- https://smartcourse.io

- http://bit.ly/sc-identity

We are all truly inspired by your interest, alignment, and professional caliber.] [Updated 10/20]
*

Some skills of particular interest include:

RESEARCH:

  • Experience in psychology/psychiatry/neuroscience/learning and attention disorders
  • Comfortable being on video and presenting content (excellent English verbal communication and camera presence)
  • Conducting evidence-based research on special needs and learning disabilities/vetting authoritative sources
  • Key-word research and mapping
  • Synthesize complex scientific articles into an easily digestible format
  • Write scripts from that complex information in a succinct, simplified (Layman's Terms), and entertaining way
  • Create customer discovery surveys that would effectively collect demographic and psychographic information, be able to present that in a concise, quantifiable way, and be able to suggest actions for Smart Course to take based on those insights
  • Willing to do Customer Service / Customer Support experience

MEDIA:

  • Animation and motion graphics (Adobe Aftereffects preferred)
  • Videography and Video Editing (Adobe Premiere and iMovie preferred)
  • Graphic design (Adobe illustrator, Photoshop, and Canva preferred)
  • Basic understanding of marketing on Youtube and Pinterest (For thumbnails and video uploads)
  • Willing to do Customer Service / Customer Support experience

MARKETING:

  • Market Research, Business Development (Customer Discovery)
  • Understanding of Digital Marketing on YouTube, Pinterest, LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook
  • Skills in email marketing (Active Campaign and HubSpot)
  • Auditing a marketing funnel using Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
  • Basic understanding of conversation rate optimization
  • Comfortable cold-calling and cold-emailing
  • Sales copywriting and blogging
  • Branding strategy
  • Willing to do Customer Service / Customer Support experience

PRODUCT:

  • Full-Stack Developer with HTML, CSS, Javascript (React, Redux, Node, Database Experience (Express MongoDB or SQL) preferred)
  • JavaScript Fullstack Web Dev / Front End Web Development
  • UI/UX design, Wix Web Design
  • WordPress expertise
  • Collecting product insights through customer discovery
  • Product management / agile development experience
  • Willing to do Customer Service / Customer Support experience

OPERATIONS:

  • Market Research, Business Development, and Customer Discovery
  • Project Management using agile methodology
  • Team Building and Recruiting (HR skills preferred)
  • Human Resources and Operations (Highly organized in design thinking for internal processes)
  • Willing to do Customer Service / Customer Support experience

Some reasons you might be interested:

  • You want to hone your creative media skills, UI/UX design, or full stack web development skills and see how they perform in a business context
  • You are looking to start your own company, dive into entrepreneurship, or want a fast-tracked career towards an executive position (e.g. Dev Ops)
  • You want to bring your interests in child development, research, education, or clinical work into a more applied setting and translate it into actions that are directly relevant to families
  • You want to collect data from parents, practice data analysis skills, and present findings in relevant settings
  • You want to meet and network with leading professionals in the field (educational psychologists, clinical psychologists, educational specialists, etc.)
  • You want to get involved in the Education Technology and/or Healthcare Technology / MedTech spaces which are growing exponentially, especially for students with special needs
  • You’re interested in entrepreneurship, startups, and/or technology and want to put your interests to good use

For this role, although experience in full stack web development is necessary, experience with WordPress or NoCode solutions is desirable, we are also looking for fearlessness, perseverance, selflessness, a deep desire to learn, and a commitment to the cause.

Our goals moving forward would be to continue partnering with organizations, influencers, or professionals that speak to parents of kids with ADHD and market Smart Course’s products and resources nationally with the help of a full stack developer, web developer, wordpress specialist, no code specialist, agile developer / product scrum master, and/or product manager, in order to become the go-to authority for online education and healthcare in the space.

We’ll be growing very quickly over the next semester.

If you might be interested in hearing more about this, we'd appreciate the opportunity to meet you.

We look forward to hearing from you,

Adrien Harrison

Founder & CEO | Smart Course | smartcourse.io

title: Wordpress Ecommerce Intern
description:
A new E-Commerce jewelry company based in Forest Hills NY, is looking to hire a highly dynamic and results-oriented Wordpress Ecommerce Intern to operate and drive traffic to our online business.

Job responsibilities include buy not limited to:

· Implement and maintain the online business through Shopify & oversee the marketplace operations.

· Develop site merchandising strategies to achieve sales and profit margin goals.

· Identify new business opportunities to increase the online assortment and improve online inventory availability by sourcing, onboarding, and managing new client relationships.

· Execute merchandising strategies online across category, subcategory, and other site content across the platforms to contribute to overall business goals.

· Product selections and update new products to e-commerce platforms.

· Organize and track daily products number and variety through inventory management and quality control.

· Update social media daily through marketing campaigns, advertising etc…

· Writing articles, newsletters and blogging.

· Contact clients to coordinate with their demands of time, products and shipping details.

· Drive traffic and direct customers certain new products or promotional products through Keywords and SEO.

· Positioning and market the products and the potential customers of target groups.

· A creative thinker with excellent interpersonal, communication, analytic and problem solving skills.

Candidates must possess the following qualifications:

· 1+ years experience in eCommerce supported by a proven record of success.

· Self-motivated, Self-starter but remains a team player.

· Knowledge of Photoshop.

· Strong communication, presentation and interpersonal skills required. A born communicator with inherent salesmanship qualities.

· Superior organizational and time management skills.

· Wants more for themselves than just a weekly salary.

· Enthusiastic with excellent people skills.

· Web Design - Online store - eCommerce Specialist.

· Search engine optimization - Search engine marketing.

· Social media management - Social media marketing - Social media stores.

· Marketplaces such as Ebay/Amazon.

Hours:

· Mon-Thurs 10:00 am - 4:00 pm

Benefits:

· Compensation: $150 Weekly Base Pay PLUS Monthly Bonuses.

WEEKLY BASE + MONTHLY BONUSES = ANNUALLY $10K - $20K

This is NOT a remote position, we will be conducting onsite interviews.

Please include samples of your work and email your resume to be considered.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $10,000.00 - $20,000.00 per year

Supplemental Pay:

  • Bonus pay

Experience:

  • Digital marketing: 1 year (Preferred)
  • SEO: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Shopify: 1 year (Preferred)

This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:

  • Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous
  • People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects
  • Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction
  • Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture
  • Achievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might fail
  • Autonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little direction
  • Innovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativity

This Company Describes Its Culture as:

  • Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focused
  • Innovative -- innovative and risk-taking
  • Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture
  • Stable -- traditional, stable, strong processes
  • People-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focused
  • Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative

Work Remotely:

  • No

title: Summer Intern, Data & Technology
description:
The Rockefeller Foundation seeks a 2021 Summer Intern to join the Data & Technology team.

We value our Summer Interns and want to invest in and mentor future leaders who will grow personally and professionally and create impact in the philanthropic sector. As a Summer Intern at The Rockefeller Foundation you will have the chance to contribute to our initiatives through engaging, meaningful work assignments.

  • This position is open only to undergraduate students (rising seniors).
  • A cover letter is required.
  • The 2021 summer program will run 10-12 weeks, with exact dates to be determined.
  • We are currently fully remote, but when restrictions ease, this position will be based in the New York office.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

  • As part of the Statistics and Machine Learning team, you will collaborate closely with Data Scientists to implement compelling, usable UIs and contribute to their design.
  • Work across the stack to deliver new features from start-to-finish.
  • Implement web or mobile interfaces using XHTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Education, Experience and Skills

  • Currently enrolled in a computer science, or related undergraduate degree program (rising seniors only).
  • Experience using Python.
  • Experience in experience with web technologies: JavaScript, XHTML, CSS.
  • Knowledge of React.
  • You value code simplicity, performance and details.
  • You are familiar with data structures and algorithms, profiling and optimization.
  • Comfortable working with remote teams.
  • Committed to the mission of the Foundation, to inclusion, equity and diversity in every aspect of your work, and to challenging conventional wisdom through evidence, reason, and amplifying dissenting, unconventional, and marginalized voices.


As an organization, we focus on six values to advance our culture and to continue our success. We are dedicated to being Transparent, Optimistic, Accountable, Collaborative, Trusted and Equitable. We operate from a strong commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion in everything that we do. It’s not only the right thing to do – we couldn’t make an impact without the diverse perspectives and experiences of our team members. We expect all employees at the Foundation to contribute by developing their unique perspective and talent, and to challenge conventional wisdom through evidence and reason, and by amplifying marginalized voices.

The Rockefeller Foundation is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and to compliance with all federal, state, and local laws concerning employment discrimination, including the Americans with Disabilities Act. To this end, the Foundation ensures equal opportunity to all employees and applicants regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, lawful alien status, physical, mental, and medical disability, veteran status or liability for service in the United States Armed Forces.

The Rockefeller Foundation is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: WordPress Developer & Admin for EdTech Startup Intern
description:

In just 10 years, by 2030, 50% of school-aged children will be failing or not enrolled in schools. Education is the biggest human rights / civil rights issue of this generation. We are optimizing learning for kids with special needs by focusing on their caregivers and technology that increases all levels of learning.

Overview

  • SmartCourse.io is a NEW (November 2019) EdTech and HealthTech startup that offers digital products and services, like online courses and coaching programs, to educate kids with special needs and their caregivers (e.g. parents, educators, medical professionals, and other caregivers).
  • Ultimately, we’re going to revolutionize the education system for these kids through a collaborative platform that connects all kids and caregivers together in order to monitor and iterate on progress effectively. Leading to healthier families, stronger academics, and more ambitious and fulfilled students.
  • Part-time/full-time roles will focus on academics, technology, curricula, and research as well as animation, videography, graphic design, UX/UI, digital marketing, sales copywriting, high-ticket selling, fundraising development, and agile project management. Roles continue to change as we progress. While the projects are rooted in customer discovery and research, they will involve strategy, innovation, operational consistency, and the ability to work in autonomous teams.
  • For an immediate start; Dates are negotiable throughout the year.
  • We are looking for both interns and early-stage employees to join the team full-time in exchange for a kickass learning experience, commission, bonuses, profit-share, and/or an equity-based payment plan depending on your value add (determined over a trial period and discussed on an individual basis.)
  • We’re based in NYC, but all positions can be entirely remote and we’ve had many outstanding colleagues all over the world.

Our goal is to not only develop technology for different learners and their caregivers but to develop strategies and technologies for the entire sectors that would eventually be used by all students.

Join a startup team with a serial entrepreneur founder who built and helped build over a dozen 6-figure businesses, one of which was another startup with over $2 million of funding commitment, and all of them launched within less than 1 year. The goal is to prove this new model and raise $2.5M in less than 1 year.

They must be able to identify obstacles and seek and recommend solutions. Must be disciplined, goal-focused individuals who can assess situations and make on-the-spot decisions that affect multiple aspects of the organization.
  • You must want to work in an organization that is fueled by passion, led by strong, experienced, leaders, but with the flair of a startup. Suits and ties need not apply. Only those who are willing to do anything it takes to succeed are welcomed. It is not about titles or badges.

Career Support

  • SmartCourse welcomes interns who want to stay with the organization after the internship, as opportunities available. As we grow, Smart Course hopes to offer plenty of potential opportunities. We strive for a model of 2/3 promotion from within, and 1/3 from outside. All previous startup staff were volunteers or interns first.

  • Takes ownership of projects, OKRs & KPIs, and delivers in advance of deadlines
  • Embodies our core values of selflessness, fearlessness, and perseverance

title: Engineering Intern
description:
Date Posted:

2020-08-18-07:00

Country:

United States of America

Location:

CANHQ: CCS HQ - Syracuse, NY 6304 Thompson Rd, Syracuse, NY, 13221 USA

Built on Willis Carrier’s invention of modern air conditioning in 1902, Carrier is a world leader in heating, air-conditioning and refrigeration solutions. We constantly build upon our history of proven innovation with new products and services that improve global comfort and efficiency. Today, Carrier needs your talent to build upon this legacy and create solutions that matter for people and our planet.

Our global Engineering team is evolving to maintain Carrier’s lead position in the market through investments in advanced research, technologies, and methods that will shape the future of our products and services. As part of this transformation, we are hiring and empowering early career talent to help us innovate and pursue sustainable solutions for our customers.

Position Summary:

The Carrier Engineering Internship Program provides opportunities to demonstrate technical and leadership capabilities and to make meaningful contributions to technical projects. In addition to challenging project work, the Carrier Engineering Internship will develop your skills through training and mentoring and enable you to get involved in employee resource groups that celebrate our diverse employees globally.

The Carrier Engineering Internship Program also serves as a feeder to the prestigious Willis Carrier Engineering Leadership Program and Graduate Hire Program for students completing undergraduate programs at competitive universities.

During your time in the program, you will have the opportunity to build your technical and leadership skills within one of the following or similar areas: Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering, or Software Engineering.

Sample Job Responsibilities:

  • Participate in Agile/Scrum software development process
  • Analyze software requirements and create innovative solutions for them
  • Contribute to full lifecycle application development
  • Design and develop web-based software applications and components in various software languages
  • Evaluate and identify new technologies for use by the software and engineering teams

Experience / Qualifications:

  • US Citizen or Permanent Resident

title: 2021 PhD Internship - Data Scientist
description:
We're looking for Ph.D. candidates to intern during summer 2021 (12 weeks). You will be embedded in a team and work closely with other data scientists, engineers, and product managers under the supervision of a data scientist on that team.

About the Role

We are hiring interns to work on the Global Marketing, Policy Economics, and Core Analytics & Science teams. Read on to learn more about these three teams.

(1) Marketing data science informs decisions across Uber's global marketing efforts, accelerating both demand and supply growth worldwide. We leverage advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, or data mining techniques in a scalable manner including large scale data processing such as Spark, Hive, and Uber's proprietary machine learning platform, and more. Interns on the team will work on projects such as:

  • Assisting in prototyping causal inference methods and econometric models to inform the efficiency of our marketing spend
  • Building propensity models to aid in the growth and profitability of different Uber products (Uber Rides Pass, Eats pass, etc.)
  • Architecting a recommendation system to understand cuisine preferences at a user-level
  • Standardizing marketing models and enhancing their scalability and stability through platformization
  • Identifying and implementing improvements to our bid, budget and creative optimization algorithms on Uber's advertising channels like Google, Facebook, etc.

(2) The Policy Economics team conducts research that forms the foundation for business decisions and our policy positions and helps policymakers, thought leaders, and the general public gain a better understanding of our platform. This team sits under the Policy, Research and Economics team; led by the Chief Economist, we are responsible for addressing the thorny policy and business challenges impacting Uber globally. As a data scientist intern on this team, you would be expected to bring analytical and empirical rigor to bear on important questions relating to the changing nature of work and the economics of marketplaces.

(3) The Core Analytics & Science (CAS) team covers both of Uber's main lines of business as well as the underlying platform technologies that power those businesses. We are a key part of Uber's cross-functional product development teams, helping to drive every stage of product development through data analytic, statistical, and algorithmic expertise. Here are the subteams within CAS that make it happen:

  • Eats: Uber Eats is Uber's ambitious and rapidly growing on-demand food delivery business currently operating in over 45 countries globally and is the largest outside of China. Eat is a 3-sided marketplace, comprising Eaters, Delivery Partners, and Restaurants. Eats interns will work on exciting and impactful projects that advance our algorithms and discover insights to improve engagement with eaters, merchants, and couriers. Projects include optimizing our eater pricing systems and routing algorithms, modeling and predicting eater and courier behavior on the platform, and improving the efficiency of user acquisition, promotions, courier experience, and merchant onboarding.
  • Rides: Rides Data Science at Uber uses data to improve and automate Uber's core ridesharing products. Rides interns will tackle problems such as optimizing Uber's short and long term pricing systems; efficiently matching incoming trip requests in Uber's dispatch system; developing innovative incentive schemes that reward riders and drivers for choosing our network; optimizing pickup and dropoff experiences for both riders and drivers, and developing algorithms and experimentation to make our rider and driver user experience stand out. We also forecast, monitor, and evaluate all aspects of our marketplace and user behavior using both large scale observational data and meticulous experimentation.
  • Platform: Platform Data Science develops the common systems and technical foundations that power Uber's trip experiences externally and core decision making systems internally. Interns on the Platform team will work on building statistical, machine learning, and optimization models for problems like travel time estimation, route optimization, search personalization, and ranking.

What You'll Do

  • Work with your mentor closely to scope a project, define the problem, and develop and prototype the solution using data-driven approaches
  • Work with engineers and product managers to turn data science prototypes into robust, reliable solutions
  • Present findings to business leaders to inform decisions
  • Establish standard methodologies for data science including modeling, coding, analytics, optimization, and experimentation
  • Conduct experiments to advise product decisions

Basic Qualifications

  • Current Ph.D. student majoring in Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Operations Research, or other quantitative fields
  • Knowledge of underlying mathematical foundations of statistics, machine learning, optimization, economics, and analytics
  • Experience with exploratory data analysis, statistical analysis, testing, and model development
  • Proficiency in languages like SQL, R, and Python

Preferred Qualifications

  • Anticipated graduation between winter 2021-summer 2022
  • Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and business partners
  • Research mentality with a bias towards action to structure a project from idea to experimentation to prototype to implementation
  • Experience in experimental design and analysis (e.g., A/B and market-level experiments), as well as causal inference
  • Independence, excellent communication, and outstanding follow-through - you energetically tackle your work and love the responsibility of being individually empowered

At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have a curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing the form.

title: Intern, Quality Engineer - Summer 2021
description:
Who We Are: New York Air Brake has been serving the rail industry since 1890 with innovative train control systems. Headquartered in Watertown, New York, with operations in Nixa & Kansas City, Missouri; Irving, Texas; West Chicago, Illinois and a brand new, state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in Salisbury, North Carolina. Known for innovation, quality, customer focus, and safety, NYAB continues to grow and offer career opportunities in a people-first environment.


This is your opportunity to make a big impact on improving the quality of how the latest generation of locomotive and freight car braking systems are manufactured. Co-op opportunity for Mechanical, Industrial or Manufacturing Engineering majors with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. You can expect challenging work and an insiders view into your future profession. You will work as an individual and as part of a project team, while receiving regular feedback in preparation for a final presentation to company leaders.


Responsibilities could include:

  • Collaborate with production teams to reduce cost and improve product quality
  • Team collaboration support including; analyzing work processes to identify opportunities to improve efficiency, balance work cell load, reduce defects, implement tooling, resolve technical issues and improve product flow.
  • Further research and development of existing products and technologies
  • Gather and coordinate data for engineers
  • Assist engineers with appropriate design details

What We Offer: Our internships are not all work. NYAB is located in Watertown, New York. When not working, spend your free time hiking the Adirondack Mountains, kayaking the many waterways, enjoying the beaches of Lake Ontario or exploring the history, food and fun the Thousand Islands Region has to offer. You are just a short drive to World Class Casino’s, Golf, Shopping and the award winning Finger Lakes Wine Country. Our interns begin work as early as the end of May and work up until the middle of August. Expect 40 hours per week and a competitive salary (based on experience and position) of up to $20 per hour. You will take part in special events, & outings, take advantage of wellness & workout programs in our fitness facility or join the lunchtime kickball league. There is something for everyone as a summer intern.


Required Skills
  • Drawing Tools – Autocad or equivalent
  • Methods – FMEA, Six Sigma, Lean Manufacturing
  • Understanding of pneumatic, hydraulic and simple electronic systems
  • Microsoft Office – Excel, PowerPoint, Word, VISIO
  • Hands on skills with mechanical tools


Required Experience

Presently attending an accredited college or university, with a GPA of 3.0 or higher

Education: Engineering majors with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Mechanical, Manufacturing Engineering or Industrial Engineer degree preferred


Offers of employment are contingent on pre-employment drug testing and criminal background screening results

title: Data Scientist Intern, Chief Analytics Office- 2021 Summer Intern
description:
Introduction
The smartest companies today fully leverage data analytics for strategic decision making.The IBM Chief Analytics Office, a division of IBM Corporate Headquarters, combines business knowledge with big data to direct the future of IBM’s strategic transformation. Do you want to drive significant change within a leading global company and influence C-suite level decisions?

START AND END DATES FOR THIS INTERNSHIP ARE DURING SUMMER 2021 (3 MONTHS)

You will work alongside consultants, managers, and senior data scientists to enhance business performance through analytics and data science focused initiatives. The position’s main role and responsibilities include:

CAOeph

About Business Unit
The IBM Chief Analytics Office is an elite analytics consulting team that is tasked by IBM executives to pursue our most complex strategic issues. Our work is a combination of data science and management consulting. Through state of the art technology, and the power of artificial intelligence we strive to improve traditional business decision-making and processes.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Being You @ IBM

title: Silicon Validation - Summer 2021 Engineering Intern
description:
Summary of Role :

This position is for summer 2021 Engineering Intern within GLOBALFOUNDRIES Technology Enablement Department located in Malta, NY. We are looking a highly skilled and motivated Engineering Intern to work on the development of advanced technology nodes, FinFET and FD-SOI, within a dynamic team of semiconductor development experts. The selected candidate will be working on advanced technology nodes (12nm/22nm/28nm).

Essential Responsibilities :

  • Work closely with FAB Technology Development and Device Modeling teams to understand and validate Design Rules and Model accuracy
  • Work with process integration and yields engineers to understand and validate prevalent process/design driven fail modes.
  • Engage in 12LP, 22FDX and 28SLP technology development by designing experimental electrical test structures to assess Advanced Packaging process/design driven fail modes followed by Silicon data analysis to identify design/process interactions and weak points
  • Si data collection thru wafer test and Si data analysis using internal and external statistical tools, fail modes review and Si validation report generation
  • Si data collection from mosfets with and without TSV. Study the impact of TSV on device behavior from electrical and thermal behavior. Verify the TSV impact on device characteristics matches process expectation.
  • Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and programs

We constantly build upon our history of proven innovation with new products and services that improve global comfort and efficiency. Today, Carrier needs your talent to build upon this legacy and create solutions that matter for people and our planet.

Our global Engineering team is evolving to maintain Carrier’s lead position in the market through investments in advanced research, technologies and methods that will shape the future of our products and services. As part of this transformation, we are hiring and empowering early career talent to help us innovate and pursue sustainable solutions for our customers.

Position Summary:

The Carrier Engineering Internship Program provides opportunities to demonstrate technical and leadership capabilities and to make meaningful contributions to technical projects. In addition to challenging project work, the Carrier Engineering Internship will develop your skills through training and mentoring and enable you to get involved in employee resource groups that celebrate our diverse employees globally.

The Carrier Engineering Internship Program also serves as a feeder to the prestigious Willis Carrier Engineering Leadership Program and Graduate Hire Program for students completing undergraduate programs at competitive universities.

During your time in the program, you will have the opportunity to build your technical and leadership skills within one of the following or similar areas: Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering, or Software Engineering.

Sample Job Responsibilities:

  • Model based design, modeling and validation of DC-DC converter and motor drive system
  • Hardware in the loop test of advanced control algorithms for DC-DC converter and motor drive system
  • System architecture and integration of future transport refrigeration system for electrical truck
  • Power electronics hardware design and test
  • HIL design and validation of electro-mechanical systems

Experience / Qualifications:

  • US Citizen or Permanent Resident
  • Proactive and results-driven; thrives in a fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Excellent analytical and communication skills
  • Excellent verbal, writing, and presentation communication skills
  • Ability to lead and work with integrity to achieve results as part of multidisciplinary teams in a global environment
  • Familiar with power electronics hardware designs, including loss analysis, magnetic component design, gate driver design, test, etc.
  • Familiar with real-time control software development for DSPs
  • Familiar with power electronics simulation tools: MATLAB, PSIM, Opal-RT or equivalent tools.

Education:

The ideal candidate will be a graduate student pursuing pursing a MS or PhD degree in in Power Eelectronics or related field. 3.2 GPA preferred, 3.0 minimum

#NSBE2020

Carrier is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.
