title: Software Developer Intern (Remote)
description:
Meltek Inc. is a pre-seed Cleantech startup whose mission is to expand reliable access to renewable energy resources in the United States and abroad. By enabling homeowners and small businesses to optimize their renewable energy and storage systems Meltek will empower more homeowners and small businesses across the United States to save money on electrical costs while enjoying greater access to clean energy.

Role –

  • Assist leadership and other developers to plan, architect, and develop applications used to monitor and manage equipment and access, manage and store data intended to enhance and optimize the installation and usage of renewable energy resources and energy storage.

Responsibilities –

  • Design platform architecture with inputs from product management
  • Fine-tune energy optimization algorithms
  • Interface the SCADA/EMS engine with visualization tools for the UI/UX
  • Implement CI/CD protocols and code
  • Manage database efforts
  • Determine inputs required to provide marketing’s desired outputs
  • Develop functions, applications, and coding to provide required outputs and control
  • Develop and optimize interfaces between various databases and applications
  • Develop interfaces between internal systems, external systems, and users

Technical Qualifications –

  • BS/MS in ECE or related field
  • Knowledge of EMS or SCADA systems
  • Experience developing a product from scratch
  • Understand full stack of technologies from backend to frontend, including but not limited to Python, MatLab, JavaScript and SQL
  • Familiarity with the entire software development lifecycle
  • Working knowledge of full-stack development, SCADA, HMI, MMI, and EMS

Personal Qualifications –

  • Clear, precise communications needed for fully remote work
  • Disciplined self-starter with an entrepreneurial mindset
  • Understanding of product development and team leadership
  • Proactive in seeking solutions to difficult technical problems
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills

Location: Remote

Note: This position will be funded through the New York State Energy Research & Development Authority (NYSERDA) Clean Energy Internship Program (Link). Only New York State-based applicants will be considered.

title: Data Science Intern - Summer 2021
description:
Seeking the challenge of building something outstanding from the ground up? At MongoDB, we're doing just that, by unlocking the power of data for developers. We're looking for curious minds to help us build the next-generation in database technology.

As we continue on our mission to become a data platform company, there's an exciting opportunity to craft the product in a way that opens the possibility for users of MongoDB Atlas to build impactful things. As a Data Science intern, joining a growing community of data enthusiasts, you will have the chance to create and make a direct impact. By conceptualizing machine learning models that help us anticipate customer behavior, or by formulating predictive models that improve the MongoDB query language, you will learn how to contribute to a data driven product.

What we are looking for in you

  • A Masters or PhD student in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Physics, Economics, Mathematics, Analytics, or other field with significant course work in statistics and research).
  • Confident programming in a statistical programming/scripting language (R, Python).
  • Have an understanding of data structures, machine learning algorithms, and computational complexity. Familiarity with design of online experiments is a plus.
  • Have a solid ability to collaborate and communicate with people from diverse professional and educational backgrounds.
  • Comfortable thinking analytically about ambiguous problems and willing to problem solve and troubleshoot regardless of methods, techniques, or tools; not hung up on implementing a convolutional neural net!

What you'll find at MongoDB

  • Write code (Python, R, SQL, etc.) for analyzing data, and build statistical models to solve specific business problems.
  • Build stakeholder-facing reports & visualizations to provide insights and metrics which help understand user behavior.
  • Collaborate with data engineers, UX researchers, software developers, and data analysts/scientists to build data science solutions and provide analytical support.
  • Find like-minded teammates who will make your New York City internship the most fun ever!

*MongoDB, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*

title: Data Science Intern
description:
At Fitch, we have an open culture where employees are able to exchange ideas and perspectives, throughout the organization, irrespective of their seniority. Your voice will be heard allowing you to have a real impact. We embrace diversity and appreciate authenticity, employees work in an environment where they can be their true selves. Our inclusive and progressive approach helps us to keep a balanced perspective.

With our expertise, we are not only creating data and information, but also producing timely insights from every angle to influence decision making in this ever changing and highly competitive market. We have a relentless hunger to innovate and unlock the power of human insights and to drive value for our customers. There has never been a better time to make an impact and we invite you to join us on this journey.

Fitch Ratings is a leading provider of credit ratings, commentary and research. Dedicated to providing value beyond the rating through independent and prospective credit opinions, Fitch Ratings offers global perspectives shaped by strong local market experience and credit market expertise. The additional context, perspective and insights we provide have helped fund a century of growth and enables you to make important credit judgments with confidence.

As a Data Science Intern at Fitch, you can contribute to the transformation of our business through the use of enhanced analytics to drive strategy, improve analytical insight, and increase automation. The Enhanced Analytics team in Fitch’s Global Public Finance & Infrastructure department is seeking a part-time data science intern to support a wide range of projects relying on careful analysis of data and development of tools relying on modern data science techniques.

The ideal candidate for this internship will have a keen ability to manipulate and analyze data with Python (NumPy, pandas, xarray). Strong data visualization skills and prior exposure to finance and/or economics are also desirable.

Job Description:

  • Collect and clean data. As always, this is a significant part of the work!
  • Translate business needs into concrete data analysis tasks, execute those tasks, and effectively communicate findings to stakeholders
  • Write scripts to automate various labor-intensive data ETL processes to support our analysis
  • Produce data-driven analytical tools, visualizations, and dashboards

Position Requirements:

  • Proven ability to produce robust, efficient, well-documented code in Python
  • Demonstrable knowledge of SQL and relational databases
  • Familiarity collecting data via REST and SOAP APIs
  • Prior experience using SciPy and related packages (NumPy, pandas, Matplotlib or Seaborn, xarray) to manipulate, analyze, and visualize data

Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning.

For more information please visit our websites: www.fitchratings.com | www.fitchsolutions.com | www.fitchlearning.com

Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will be asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts prior to commencing employment. If you, or your immediate family, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, you may be asked to divest yourself of them before beginning work.

Fitch is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Intern - Summer 2021 - Quality Engineering
description:
Why Crestron?:
At Crestron Electronics, Inc we build the technology that integrates technology.

We are proud to be the largest and most recognized brand in automation and control solutions, and the premier technology partner for fortune 500 businesses globally.

Our products are integrated into new high-tech commercial buildings’ to include some of the most exciting real estate throughout the world. Our clients include Google, Microsoft, Amazon, LinkedIn and many others. We are the leaders in one of the most exciting and fastest growing industries in the world!

Our automation and control solutions for homes and buildings allow our clients to control entire environments with the push of a button, integrating systems such as Audio Visual, Lighting, Shading, Security, Building Management Systems and HVAC to provide greater comfort, convenience and security.
Overview:
Crestron Electronics continues to experience rapid growth as we invest in resources and create new opportunities; as a result, we have an exciting opportunity for a Summer 2021 Intern (May 26th, 2021 - August, 13th, 2021) to join our Quality Assurance Engineering team in Orangeburg, NY.
Responsibilities:
The responsibilities of the Quality Assurance Engineering intern include, but are not limited to:
  • Perform updates to standard reliability test report templates
  • Assist with documentation of various department standard processes
  • Execute benchmarking tests to gather data and assist with developing standard requirements for various reliability tests
  • Assist with implementation and programming of new robotic arm
  • Assist with test plan development for NPI projects
  • Assist with build-to-print part inspection plan development

Qualifications:
General Requirements
  • Must be enrolled in a college or university working toward a bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering or closely related field.
  • Must be available to work up to 40 hours per week during the entire internship period beginning May 26th, 2021 and ending August 13th, 2021.
  • Must be commutable to and from the Orangeburg, NY area for the duration of the internship period.
Technical Skills
  • Ability to write technical reports with a clear presentation of test data and results
  • Must be familiar with basic mechanical engineering theories
  • Must possess the ability to effectively analyze and resolve problems - assess a situation, gather data, analyze the data, propose a solution
  • Must have a minimal familiarity with CAD software (examples are AutoCAD, Creo, Solidworks, IDEAS, or similar programs)
  • Some familiarity with laboratory test equipment (force gauges, torsion machines, etc.) and measurement equipment (calipers, height gauges, etc).
  • Some familiarity with electronic equipment and programming
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office programs – Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio
  • Ability to think outside the box and provide creative solutions to engineering problems
Other Skills:
  • Must be responsible, self-motivated, creative, have a solid work ethic and have a desire to produce a quality product
  • Strong communication skills (verbal, non-verbal, written, and listening) with the ability to articulate work at different levels of the organization
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Inquisitive individual with a desire to learn, possessing a long term desire to work in the Quality Engineering/Reliability Engineering space
  • Ability to prioritize tasks and handle numerous assignments simultaneously
  • Positive, personable, and able to work cohesively with other across various divisions
  • Must be a high-energy, hands-on individual that is self-confident in his/her technical abilities.
  • Must be very detail-oriented and thorough in performing tasks.

EOE/M/F/D/V

title: INTERNSHIP – Energy Market Products
description:
Job Description:

The New York Independent System Operator (NYISO) applies cutting-edge technology to operating a reliable electricity system, managing competitive markets for wholesale electricity, and planning for the Empire State's energy future. The NYISO invites applications for a full-time summer intern on the Energy Market Products team.

This intern will be working with both the Energy Market Products and Enterprise Infrastructure Products teams. The Business Analysts on these teams collaborate with IT and the business on development of detailed requirements and product documentation. The intern will work with the Energy Market Products team on the creation of user stories in JIRA to support requirements traceability on several projects, and work with the Enterprise Infrastructure Products team to support detailed requirement development and smoke testing on several projects.




Job Requirements:
  • Current enrollment in Electrical Engineer, Economics, Computer Science, or related technical degree program
  • Some experience in any portion of the Software Development Life Cycle
  • Technical Writing Skills

The NYISO takes pride in recruiting, developing and retaining highly talented individuals. Our summer internship programs give young professionals the opportunity to gain a fundamental understanding of New York electricity markets, bulk electricity systems and how we plan for New York State’s energy future.

All offers of employment will be made contingent upon the successful completion of a drug screening and background check.

The NYISO is an Equal Opportunity Employer and as such, does not discriminate in its hiring or employment practices.

title: Process Engineer Intern
description:
Position Overview:
Come join a company that is investing and expanding! Novelis is looking for Juniors and Seniors who are interested in an Process Engineer Internship or Co Op beginning on or around May 20th.

Novelis is the world leader in aluminum rolling, producing an estimated 14 percent of the world's flat-rolled aluminum products. With industry-leading assets and technology, Novelis produces the highest-quality aluminum sheet and foil products for customers in high-value markets including automotive, transportation, packaging, construction and printing.
Responsibilities & Qualifications:
Our customers include major brands such Jaguar, Ford, BMW, Coca-Cola, Anheuser-Busch InBev, Rexam, Ball, Crown, ThyssenKrupp and others. In addition to being the world leader in aluminum rolling, Novelis is leading the industry with our sustainability and recycling efforts. Currently, Novelis recycles 50 billion used beverage cans annually – enough to circle the earth more than 100 times.

Headquartered in Atlanta, GA, Novelis operates in 11 countries, has approximately 11,000 employees and reported revenue of approximately $9.9 billion for its 2016 fiscal year. For more information, please visit novelis.com and follow us at facebook.com/Novelis Inc. and twitter.com/Novelis.
Location Profile:
Novelis’ Oswego facility is located on Lake Ontario in north-central New York and employs approximately 1100 people. The Oswego site produces more than a billion pounds of high-quality aluminum sheet each year in order to serve our customers in the automotive beverage can and specialty markets. In addition to museums and public parks many Oswego residents and visitors enjoy boating fishing hiking and other local recreational activities. Novelis is committed to the Oswego community through its ongoing support of the local United Way Habitat for Humanity Oswego Harborfest and many other worthwhile community and civic organizations. Novelis recognizes its talented and diverse workforce as a key competitive advantage. Novelis provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants. All terms and conditions of employment at Novelis including recruiting hiring placement promotion termination layoffs recalls transfers leaves of absence compensation and training are without regard to race color religion age sex national origin disability status genetics protected veteran status sexual orientation gender identity or expression or any other characteristic protected by federal provincial or local laws.

title: Staff Engineer Intern - Summer 2021
description:

At Bohler, we empower the ambitious to become the accomplished. This greater purpose connects us with like-minded professionals, fosters meaningful relationships, and generates the alignment necessary to produce an unrivaled consulting and employment experience.

Our Hauppauge, NY office is looking for a Staff Engineer Intern who embodies this purpose.

title: Intern-Software Engineer
description:

title: Information Security Analyst Intern | Summer 2021
description:
About the Role

The Liquidnet Infosec Internship offers the candidate the ability to experience information security in real world scenarios. It is the mission of the Infosec Department to protect Liquidnet’s data, members, and employees from nefarious actors. Utilizing best in class tools, adherence to industry frameworks and an extremely motivated team, the chosen candidate will be a hands on asset in helping us achieve this mission.

Responsibilities

• Examine application architectures, assess the security risks they pose and suggest mitigations

  • Participate in product evaluations
  • Write scripts for access control auditing with our team and network vulnerability scan parsing
  • Assist with security assessments and audits (firewall rules, wireless networks, etc.)
  • Assist with security monitoring and response tasks
  • Share the latest thinking on information security topics

Skills and Experience

  • A motivated learner, keen on absorbing all that happens within Infosec
  • The candidate is studying cybersecurity or a related field
  • Familiar with Windows and Linux operating systems
  • Excellent communication skills
